critique: The document pertains to amendments to Schedule A, Subdivision VIII, paragraph 5, of positions excepted from examination under the civil service rules, specifically concerning the Indian Service. It outlines various roles within the Indian Service that are exempt from civil service examinations, including disciplinarians, judges, police, interpreters, financial clerks, physicians, livestock superintendents, special officers for liquor traffic suppression, and employees of the Neopit Lumber Mills. The document also revokes several paragraphs from the subdivision and adds attendants employed at hospitals and sanatoria to the list of exceptions. The document reflects the policies and practices of the U.S. government in relation to Native Americans during the early 20th century.
